newsitem.title: USA: Judge dismisses actor's suit against drug dealer.
newsitem.headline: Judge dismisses actor's suit against drug dealer.

text.p: A judge Monday dismissed a wrongful death suit brought by actor Carroll O'Connor -- TV's Archie Bunker -- against the man he claimed caused his son to commit suicide.
Superior Court Judge Malcolm Mackey said that O'Connor's suit against Harry Perzigian had been filed after the one-year statute of limitations had expired.

Perzigian, who was sentenced last year to one year in prison for possessing and furnishing cocaine, has a dafamation lawsuit pending against O'Connor, who starred as the working-class bigot Bunker in the hit 1970s comedy "All In the Family".
Hugh O'Connor, the actor's adopted son, who also appeared with his father in the TV series "In the Heat of the Night", shot himself in the head March 28, 1995.
His father alleged he was under the influence of drugs provided by Perzigian.
Perzigian's suit is based on public statements O'Connor made, alleging Perzigian was "a partner in murder."
